reference.title: Plugin Settings
reference.shortdesc: Overview of all the configurable plugin settings.

property.propdesc: Your name. Doesn't have to be the real one. Can also be blank, in which case, you'll be chatting as Anonymous. Your co-workers will thank you, if you give a name, though, and doesn't reach external servers, anyways.

Your email address registered with the Gravatar service. If you enter it, it will get saved in each document you write a message in. Enables co-workers to, if enabled on their end, see a profile picture in your messages.

property.propvalue: yes or no, no by default
property.propdesc: If enabled, the plugin will load profile pictures from Gravatar for the messages you see and display them to you (when you have an internet connection). This, for technical reasons, requires sending some data (no message contents or anything like that) to the service providers of Gravatar. As this feature is nice-to have, but may be a privacy concern for you, it's purely opt-in (meaning turned off by default).
